article.para: In order to improve the chance of continued funding for the InterMine project it would be really appreciated if anyone that uses InterMine or parts of InterMine would let us know. Just drop a quick email to info[at]intermine.org.
InterMine is open-source software, available for download and use under the terms of the GNU LGPL licence.

sect1.title: Obtaining the source code
sect1.para: The source code can be obtained via a download, or via anonymous CVS.

sect2.title: Downloading the source code
sect2.para: The source code can be downloaded as either an official release, or a nightly build. The source code is available in tar.gz or ZIP format.
Official releases - this is where the official InterMine release appear. Official releases are planned to occur every couple of months, on average.

Nightly build - this is a snapshot of the InterMine source code taken last night. This will work, but may be in a state of flux, and with portions undocumented, or not conforming to the documentation.

sect1.title: Building InterMine from the source code
sect1.para: The only prerequisite for building InterMine is Ant. This should be downloaded and installed on your machine.
Depending on your requirements there are a choice of targets that you can build, issue the commands ant help to display user targets and ant -projecthelp for full target list.

sect2.title: Building an InterMine client
sect2.para: An InterMine client is simply a program that accesses the InterMine data, the data being on a local machine, or accessed via an InterMine webservice.

itemizedlist.listitem: Issue the command ant jar (if building from source). This will create the files intermine.jar and intermine-all.jar in the dist directory. intermine-all.jar contains all dependent libraries as well as the InterMine classes.
Copy the file intermine-all.jar to a directory on your classpath, OR intermine.jar plus any of the jars in the lib/ directory that you don't already have.

Write a program using the InterMine Query API. Many things (such as locations of the data) are configurable by having a file intermine.properties in your classpath (earlier than intermine.jar). An example intermine.properties can be found in the jar file or click here.

sect2.title: Building an InterMine web site
sect2.para: An InterMine website is the front end to an InterMine ObjectStore.

itemizedlist.listitem: Ensure you have an running Tomcat installation, including the manager application.
Configure the webserver properties in the build.properties file.
Configure the underlying ObjectStore properties in the intermine.properties file.

sect2.title: Building an InterMine web service
sect2.para: An InterMine webservice provides SOAP access to an underlying ObjectStore.

itemizedlist.listitem: Ensure you have an running Tomcat installation, including the manager application.
Configure the webserver properties in the build.properties file.
Configure the underlying ObjectStore properties in the intermine.properties file.
